title: Trust in the LORD
shortSummary: Psalm 125 is a brief but powerful song of trust and security in the LORD, likening those who trust Him to Mount Zion, unmovable and eternal. It emphasizes God's protective presence around His people and the assurance of peace for the righteous, while warning of judgment for the wicked.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to the time of the Psalms collection

keyCharacters.name: The Righteous
keyCharacters.description: Believers who trust in the LORD and live uprightly, depicted as secure and protected like Mount Zion.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Those who turn aside to crooked ways and oppose God's righteousness, destined for judgment alongside workers of iniquity.

definitions.definition: A type of Psalm sung by pilgrims ascending to Jerusalem, often reflecting trust and worship during the journey.
A biblical symbol for Jerusalem and God's eternal, unshakable presence among His people.
A symbol of authority and discipline, often representing God's judgment or correction.
Sin or moral wrongdoing; actions that violate God's law.

outline.heading: The Security of Trusting in the LORD
outline.description: The Psalm opens by affirming that those who trust in the LORD are as immovable and secure as Mount Zion, surrounded and protected by God like the mountains around Jerusalem, highlighting God's eternal protection.

outline.heading: The Protection of the Righteous
outline.description: Godâ€™s protective discipline prevents the wicked from oppressing the righteous, guarding them from falling into sin through temptation or persecution.

outline.heading: Prayer for Blessing on the Upright
outline.description: A petition asking God to bless and do good to those who are good and upright in heart, emphasizing the importance of inner righteousness.

outline.heading: Judgment on the Wicked and Peace for Israel
outline.description: The Psalm concludes with a warning that those who turn to crooked ways will be led away with evildoers, while peace is promised upon Israel, underscoring the contrast between the fate of the wicked and the blessing of God's people.

application: Place your full trust in the LORD, knowing He provides unshakable security like Mount Zion.
Seek to maintain uprightness in heart to receive God's blessings and protection.
Avoid turning to sinful or crooked ways, recognizing that God disciplines and judges the wicked.
Pray for peace upon God's people and strive to live in harmony with His will.

keyVerses.text: They that trust in the LORD shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.
keyVerses.significance: This verse powerfully illustrates the steadfast security of those who place their trust in God.

keyVerses.text: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes God's continual and eternal protection surrounding His people.

keyVerses.text: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.
keyVerses.significance: This verse contrasts the judgment awaiting the wicked with the peace promised to God's people.
